text: outlines propose change rgeoboundaries.

title: Contributing to rgeoboundaries
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to rgeoboundaries
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to rgeoboundaries
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("wmgeolab/rgeoboundaries", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to rgeoboundaries
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: rgeoboundaries package provides straightforward interface downloading working global political administrative boundary data geoBoundaries project (Runfola et al. 2020). datasets openly licensed (CC 4.0) cover countries worldwide across multiple administrative levels. rgeoboundaries, can easily fetch boundary geometries sf objects, explore metadata, cache datasets locally, seamlessly integrate boundaries spatial workflows.

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: geoBoundaries database undergoes rigorous quality assurance process, including manual review hand-digitization physical maps necessary. primary goal provide highest possible level spatial accuracy scientific academic applications. precision comes cost: files can quite large may take longer download. visualization general mapping purposes, recommend using simplified datasets available setting simplified = TRUE. Comparison full vs. simplified map.
code: library(rgeoboundaries) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Different resolutions norway <- gb_get_adm0("NOR") %>%   mutate(res = "Full resolution") print(object.size(norway), units = "Mb") #> 26.5 Mb  norway_simp <- gb_get_adm0(country = "NOR", simplified = TRUE) %>%   mutate(res = "Simplified") print(object.size(norway_simp), units = "Mb") #> 1.5 Mb  norway_all <- bind_rows(norway, norway_simp)  # Plot ggplot2 ggplot(norway_all) +   geom_sf(fill = "#BA0C2F", color = "#00205B") +   facet_wrap(vars(res)) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: geoBoundaries API provides individual country files, whose aim represent every nation “represent ”, special identification disputed areas. download data implemented gb_get() gb_get_adm family functions. guaranteed borders align perfectly gaps countries. Additionally, files include special identification disputed areas. Map showing overlapping disputed area: Kashmir. Note individual data files governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary.
code: india_pak <- gb_get_adm0(c("India", "Pakistan"))  # Disputed area: Kashmir ggplot(india_pak) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = shapeName), alpha = 0.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FF671F", "#00401A")) +   labs(     fill = "Country",     title = "Map of India & Pakistan",     subtitle = "Note overlapping in Kashmir region",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   ) gb_get_metadata(c("India", "Pakistan"), adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   select(boundaryName, boundaryLicense, boundarySource) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   boundaryName boundaryLicense                                    boundarySource #>   <chr>        <chr>                                              <chr>          #> 1 India        CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedicat… geoBoundaries… #> 2 Pakistan     Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0        OpenStreetMap…

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: prefer data explicitly includes disputed areas, please use gb_get_world(). function downloads global composite datasets administrative boundaries, also known CGAZ (Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones). three important distinctions CGAZ individual country downloads: Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions. Gaps borders filled. Map showing overlapping Kashmir, provided CGAZ.
code: cgaz_india_pak <- gb_get_world(c("India", "Pakistan"))  ggplot(cgaz_india_pak) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = shapeName), alpha = 0.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FF671F", "#00401A")) +   labs(     fill = "Country",     title = "Map of India & Pakistan",     subtitle = "CGAZ does not overlap",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: package provides built-mechanism cache files locally repeated downloads country/level use cached version. example: Specific cache directories function call can set using path argument function.
code: # Current folder current <- gb_get_cache()  current #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpFK4kAY"  # Change to new newdir <- file.path(tempdir(), "/geoboundvignette") gb_set_cache(newdir) #> ✔ rgeoboundaries cache directory is '/tmp/RtmpFK4kAY//geoboundvignette'. #> ℹ To install your `path` for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  # Download example <- gb_get_adm0("Vatican City", quiet = FALSE) #> ℹ Downloading file from <https://github.com/wmgeolab/geoBoundaries/raw/9469f09/releaseData/gbOpen/VAT/ADM0/geoBoundaries-VAT-ADM0-all.zip> #> → Cache dir is '/tmp/RtmpFK4kAY//geoboundvignette/gbOpen'  gb_list_cache() #> [1] "gbOpen/geoBoundaries-VAT-ADM0-all.zip"  # Restore cache dir gb_set_cache(current) #> ✔ rgeoboundaries cache directory is '/tmp/RtmpFK4kAY'. #> ℹ To install your `path` for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  current == gb_get_cache() #> [1] TRUE

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: boundaries returned sf objects, can easily use combination spatial data: Clip raster data administrative units Compute zonal statistics Create choropleth maps Perform spatial joins survey tabular data example create choropleth map using meta data individual files boundaries data CGAZ: World Bank Income Group: Latin America Caribbean
code: # Metadata  latam_meta <- gb_get_metadata(adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   select(boundaryISO, boundaryName, Continent, worldBankIncomeGroup) %>%   filter(Continent == "Latin America and the Caribbean") %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 47 #> Columns: 4 #> $ boundaryISO          <chr> "ABW", "AIA", "ARG", "ATG", "BES", "BHS", "BLM", … #> $ boundaryName         <chr> "Aruba", "Anguilla", "Argentina", "Antigua and Ba… #> $ Continent            <chr> "Latin America and the Caribbean", "Latin America… #> $ worldBankIncomeGroup <chr> "High-income Countries", "No income group availab…  # Adjust factors latam_meta$income_factor <- factor(latam_meta$worldBankIncomeGroup,   levels = c(     "High-income Countries",     "Upper-middle-income Countries",     "Lower-middle-income Countries",     "Low-income Countries"   ) )  # Get the shapes from CGAZ latam_sf <- gb_get_world(adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   inner_join(latam_meta,     by =       c("shapeGroup" = "boundaryISO")   )  ggplot(latam_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = income_factor)) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Greens", direction = -1) +   guides(fill = guide_legend(position = "bottom", nrow = 2)) +   coord_sf(     crs = "+proj=laea +lon_0=-75 +lat_0=-15"   ) +   labs(     title = "World Bank Income Group",     subtitle = "Latin America and the Caribbean",     fill = "",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the geoBoundaries Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: rgeoboundaries package makes easy fetch, manage visualize administrative boundary data worldwide reproducible efficient way. Whether ’re mapping, spatial analysis, survey integration geospatial modelling, gives high-quality boundary dataset minimal overhead.

what: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
title: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: Attribution required using geoBoundaries.

title: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: rgeoboundaries package provides R-friendly interface access work geoBoundaries dataset (open-license global database administrative boundary polygons). Using package, can: Programmatically retrieve administrative boundary geometries (e.g., country → region → district) geoBoundaries Use tidyverse / sf workflows R map, analyse join boundaries data Work open-data context (geoBoundaries uses CC -4.0) / open licences1) short: work geospatial boundaries R (shape files, polygons, join data), package simplifies process.

title: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: can install developing version rgeoboundaries :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("dieghernan/rgeoboundaries")

title: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
code: library(rgeoboundaries)  sri_lanka_adm1 <- gb_get_adm1("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm2 <- gb_get_adm2("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm3 <- gb_get_adm3("Sri Lanka")  library(sf) library(dplyr)  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(sri_lanka_adm3) +   geom_sf(fill = "#DFDFDF", color = "white") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm2, fill = NA, color = "#F0B323") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm1, fill = NA, color = "black") +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org") +   theme_void()

title: rgeoboundaries | A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset
text: See map logo can created: Map rgeoboundaries logo
code: library(rgeoboundaries) library(sf) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)   world <- gb_get_world(adm_lvl = 1)  # Template: Sea as background bbox_template <- st_bbox(world)  sea <- c(-179.9, -89, 179.9, 89) names(sea) <- names(bbox_template) class(sea) <- class(bbox_template)  sea_poly <- sea |>   st_as_sfc() |>   st_set_crs(st_crs(world)) |>   st_segmentize(dfMaxLength = 50000)  sea_line <- sea_poly |> st_cast("LINESTRING") ggplot(sea_poly) +   geom_sf(fill = "#bee0ff") +   geom_sf(data = world, fill = "#f0b323", color = "white", linewidth = 0.1) +   geom_sf(data = sea_line, color = "black") +   coord_sf(expand = TRUE, crs = "+proj=robin") +   theme_void()

what: Deprecated and renamed functions in rgeoboundaries — deprecated
title: Deprecated and renamed functions in rgeoboundaries — deprecated
text: rgeoboundaries 2.0.0 renamed number functions ensure every function object_verb() naming scheme avoiding magical defaults. geoboundaries() -> gb_get() gb_get_world(). gb_adm* family -> gb_get_adm* family. gb_metadata() -> gb_get_metadata(). gb_max_adm_lvl() -> gb_get_max_adm_lvl(). functions likely removed future.

title: Deprecated and renamed functions in rgeoboundaries — deprecated
code: geoboundaries(   country = NULL,   adm_lvl = "adm0",   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm0(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm1(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm2(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm3(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm4(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_adm5(   country = NULL,   type = "unsimplified",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   version = deprecated() )  gb_metadata(   country = NULL,   adm_lvl = "all",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative") )  gb_max_adm_lvl(   country = NULL,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative") )

title: Deprecated and renamed functions in rgeoboundaries — deprecated
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) also accepted. type character. One "simplified" "unsimplified". values assumed "unsimplified". release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. version Deprecated argument.

title: Deprecated and renamed functions in rgeoboundaries — deprecated
text: functions re-directed replacement, providing output.

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
text: Utilities manage local cache directory used rgeoboundaries downloaded boundary files. helpers let set cache directory, retrieve active directory, list cached files remove cached files whole cache. primary functions : gb_set_cache(): configure files stored (temporary default). gb_get_cache(): get active cache directory path. gb_list_cache(): list files present cache. gb_clear_cache(): remove cached files (optionally installed config). gb_delete_from_cache(): remove one specific cached files.

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
code: gb_set_cache(path, install = FALSE, overwrite = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)  gb_get_cache(create = deprecated())  gb_list_cache(full_path = FALSE)  gb_clear_cache(force = TRUE, clear_config = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)  gb_delete_from_cache(file)

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
text: path character. Path directory use cache. omitted empty, temporary directory inside base::tempdir() used. install logical. TRUE, write chosen path package configuration directory used future sessions. Defaults FALSE. path omitted tempdir(), install forced FALSE. overwrite logical. TRUE install = TRUE, overwrite existing installed cache path. Defaults FALSE. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. create . full_path logical, TRUE returns full path cached files. FALSE just path relative cache directory provided. force logical.  permissions changed (possible)     allow file directory removed? clear_config logical. TRUE, delete configuration folder rgeoboundaries. file character. Base name cached file delete.

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
text: gb_set_cache(): (invisibly) returns cache directory path (character) set. gb_get_cache(): returns active cache directory path (character). gb_list_cache(): returns character vector cached file names full paths depending full_path argument. gb_clear_cache() gb_delete_from_cache(): Called side effects.

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
text: default, cache path set package uses folder inside base::tempdir() (files temporary removed R session ends). persist cache across R sessions, use gb_set_cache(path, install = TRUE) writes chosen path small configuration file tools::R_user_dir("rgeoboundaries", "config").

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
text: occasional use, rely default tempdir()-based cache (install). Modify cache single session setting gb_set_cache(path). reproducible workflows, install persistent cache gb_set_cache(path, install = TRUE) kept across R sessions. caching specific files, use path argument corresponding function. See gb_get().

title: rgeoboundaries cache utilities — gb_cache
code: # Caution! This may modify your current state  # \dontrun{ my_cache <- gb_get_cache() # Set an example cache ex <- file.path(tempdir(), "example", "cache") gb_set_cache(ex, quiet = TRUE)  newcache <- gb_get_cache() newcache #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpnWbsG3/example/cache"  # Write files to path cat(1:10000L, file = file.path(newcache, "a.txt")) cat(1:10000L, file = file.path(newcache, "b.txt")) cat(1:10000L, file = file.path(newcache, "c.txt"))  # List cache gb_list_cache() #> [1] "a.txt" "b.txt" "c.txt"  # Delete one file gb_delete_from_cache("a.txt") #> ✔ File /tmp/RtmpnWbsG3/example/cache/a.txt deleted.  gb_list_cache() #> [1] "b.txt" "c.txt"  # Delete all gb_clear_cache(quiet = FALSE) #> ! rgeoboundaries data deleted: /tmp/RtmpnWbsG3/example/cache  gb_list_cache() #> character(0)  # Restore initial cache gb_set_cache(my_cache) #> ✔ rgeoboundaries cache directory is /tmp/RtmpnWbsG3/rgeoboundaries. #> ℹ To install your `path` for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`. identical(my_cache, gb_get_cache()) #> [1] TRUE # }

text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) also accepted. simplified logical. Return simplified boundary . default FALSE use premier geoBoundaries release. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. path path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()).

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: sf object.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: Individual data files geoBoundaries database governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary (see gb_get_metadata(). Users using individual boundary files geoBoundaries additionally ensure citing sources provided metadata file. See Examples. following wrappers also available: gb_get_adm0() returns country boundary. gb_get_adm1() returns first-level administration boundaries (e.g. States United States). gb_get_adm2() returns second-level administration boundaries (e.g. Counties United States). gb_get_adm3() returns third-level administration boundaries (e.g. towns cities countries). gb_get_adm4() returns fourth-level administration boundaries. gb_get_adm5() returns fifth-level administration boundaries.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
code: # \donttest{ # Map level 2 in Sri Lanka sri_lanka <- gb_get(   "Sri Lanka",   adm_lvl = 2,   simplified = TRUE )  sri_lanka #> Simple feature collection with 25 features and 5 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 79.65102 ymin: 5.919017 xmax: 81.87896 ymax: 9.835791 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 25 × 6 #>    shapeName     shapeISO shapeID shapeGroup shapeType                  geometry #>  * <chr>         <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>            <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #>  1 Jaffna Distr… LK-41    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((79.7152 9.529465, 79.… #>  2 Kilinochchi … LK-42    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.01015 9.472403, 80… #>  3 Mannar Distr… LK-43    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.11535 9.209068, 80… #>  4 Mullaitivu D… LK-45    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.61353 9.456581, 80… #>  5 Vavuniya Dis… LK-44    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.23541 8.680412, 80… #>  6 Galle Distri… LK-31    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((79.98757 6.440352, 79… #>  7 Hambantota D… LK-33    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.67006 6.306029, 80… #>  8 Matara Distr… LK-32    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.3818 5.965264, 80.… #>  9 Ampara Distr… LK-52    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((81.70788 6.51073, 81.… #> 10 Anuradhapura… LK-71    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.03237 8.527211, 80… #> # ℹ 15 more rows  library(ggplot2) ggplot(sri_lanka) +   geom_sf() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")  # }  # Metadata library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union gb_get_metadata(   "Sri Lanka",   adm_lvl = 2 ) %>%   # what: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: Attribution required uses dataset. functions wrappers gb_get() extracting given administration level: gb_get_adm0() returns country boundary. gb_get_adm1() returns first-level administration boundaries (e.g. States United States). gb_get_adm2() returns second-level administration boundaries (e.g. Counties United States). gb_get_adm3() returns third-level administration boundaries (e.g. towns cities countries). gb_get_adm4() returns fourth-level administration boundaries. gb_get_adm5() returns fifth-level administration boundaries. Note countries number levels. Check gb_get_max_adm_lvl.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
code: gb_get_adm0(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )  gb_get_adm1(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )  gb_get_adm2(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )  gb_get_adm3(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )  gb_get_adm4(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )  gb_get_adm5(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = NULL )

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: geoBoundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). simplified logical. Return simplified boundary . default FALSE use premier geoBoundaries release. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. path path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()).

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: sf object.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: Individual data files geoBoundaries database governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary (see gb_get_metadata(). Users using individual boundary files geoBoundaries additionally ensure citing sources provided metadata file.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLOS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

See also countrycode::countrycode(). release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes.

title: Get the highest administrative level available for a given country — gb_get_max_adm_lvl
code: all <- gb_get_max_adm_lvl() library(dplyr)  # Countries with only 1 level available all %>%   filter(maxBoundaryType == 1) #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    boundaryISO maxBoundaryType #>    <chr>                 <int> #>  1 AND                       1 #>  2 ARE                       1 #>  3 ATG                       1 #>  4 BHR                       1 #>  5 BRB                       1 #>  6 DMA                       1 #>  7 GRD                       1 #>  8 GRL                       1 #>  9 KNA                       1 #> 10 LBY                       1 #> # ℹ 11 more rows  # Countries with level 4 available all %>%   filter(maxBoundaryType == 4) #> # A tibble: 18 × 2 #>    boundaryISO maxBoundaryType #>    <chr>                 <int> #>  1 AUT                       4 #>  2 BEL                       4 #>  3 BGD                       4 #>  4 CZE                       4 #>  5 FJI                       4 #>  6 GLP                       4 #>  7 IRN                       4 #>  8 ITA                       4 #>  9 LKA                       4 #> 10 MDG                       4 #> 11 MTQ                       4 #> 12 MYT                       4 #> 13 REU                       4 #> 14 SLB                       4 #> 15 SLE                       4 #> 16 SVK                       4 #> 17 UGA                       4 #> 18 ZAF                       4

what: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
text: function returns metadadata geoBoundaries API.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
code: gb_get_metadata(   country = "all",   adm_lvl = "all",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative") )

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
text: geoBoundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) also accepted. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata
text: tibble class tbl_df columns: boundaryID: ID layer, combination ISO code, boundary type, unique identifier boundary generated based input metadata geometry. changes underlying data changes. boundaryName: name country layer represents. boundaryISO: ISO-3166-1 (Alpha 3) code country. boundaryYearRepresented: year, range years "START END" format, boundary layers represent. boundaryType: type boundary. boundaryCanonical: canonical name given boundary. boundarySource: comma-separated list primary sources boundary. boundarySource: comma-separated list primary sources boundary. boundaryLicense: original license dataset released primary source. licenseDetail: notes regarding license. licenseSource: URL primary source. sourceDataUpdateDate: date source information integrated geoBoundaries repository. buildDate: date source data recently standardized built geoBoundaries release. Continent: continent country associated . UNSDG-region: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) region country associated . UNSDG-subregion: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) subregion country associated . worldBankIncomeGroup: World Bank income group country associated . admUnitCount: Count administrative units file. meanVertices: Mean number vertices defining boundaries administrative unit layer. minVertices: Minimum number vertices defining boundary. maxVertices: Maximum number vertices defining boundary. minPerimeterLengthKM: minimum perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). meanPerimeterLengthKM: mean perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). maxPerimeterLengthKM: maximum perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). meanAreaSqKM: mean area administrative units layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). minAreaSqKM: minimum area administrative unit layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). maxAreaSqKM: maximum area administrative unit layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). staticDownloadLink: static download link aggregate zip file containing boundary information. gjDownloadURL: static download link geoJSON. tjDownloadURL: static download link topoJSON. imagePreview: static download link automatically rendered PNG layer. simplifiedGeometryGeoJSON: static download link simplified geoJSON.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_metadata

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_world
text: Attribution required uses dataset. function returns global composite required administration level, clipped international boundaries, gaps filled borders.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_world
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values administrative levels 0, 1 2 ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (0, 1, 2) also accepted. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. path path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()).

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_world
text: sf object.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_world
text: Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones (CGAZ) set global composites administrative boundaries. two important distinctions global product individual country downloads. Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_world
text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

code: # This download may take some time # \dontrun{ world <- gb_get_world()  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(world) +   geom_sf() +   coord_sf(expand = FALSE) +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")  # }

what: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset — rgeoboundaries-package
title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset — rgeoboundaries-package
text: Access data 'geoBoundaries' API https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html, provides country-level political administrative boundary datasets. See Runfola, D. et al. (2020) doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: rgeoboundaries: A Client for the 'geoBoundaries' Administrative Boundaries Dataset — rgeoboundaries-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Ahmadou Dicko mail@ahmadoudicko.com (ORCID) contributors: Andy South southandy@gmail.com (ORCID) [contributor] Daniel Runfola team@geoboundaries.org (ORCID) [contributor] Rohith Reddy Mandala rohithreddy.m4@gmail.com [contributor] William Mary geoLab [copyright holder]

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: API completely revised provide clearer function names improve internal maintainability. old functions deprecated issue warning used, providing guidance appropriate replacement. Internally, calls deprecated functions redirected corresponding replacements. Additionally, former magical default country = NULL argument (returned global composite dataset) deprecated. replaced dedicated function: gb_get_world(). Renamed functions: geoboundaries() -> gb_get() gb_get_world(). latter retrieves composite global dataset, per-country calls can generated fly dataset. gb_adm* family -> gb_get_adm* family. gb_metadata() -> gb_get_metadata(). gb_max_adm_lvl() -> gb_get_max_adm_lvl().

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: Download logic now implemented using httr2. Internal informational messages generated using cli.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: Review README. Create pkgdown site https://dieghernan.github.io/rgeoboundaries/. Add vignette.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: Cache handling fully reviewed: Temporary cache (single R session): gb_set_cache(path). Persistent cache across R sessions: gb_set_cache(path, install = TRUE). Specific files: use path argument corresponding function e.g. gb_get(..., path = path). Redesigned cache-management functions: gb_set_cache(): configure files stored. gb_get_cache(): retrieve active cache directory. gb_list_cache(): list files cache. gb_clear_cache(): remove cached files (optionally removing installed config). gb_delete_from_cache(): remove one specific cached files.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: Improved package tests coverage. Added CI checks via GitHub Actions.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: New maintainer: Diego Hernangómez (https://github.com/dieghernan/). Added William & Mary geoLab copyright holder. Revised Title Description clearer links citations. Tidy dependencies.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: inst/CITATION (using bibentry() https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0231866). inst/COPYRIGHTS. inst/REFERENCES.bib. CITATION.cff codemeta.json inst/schemaorg.json.

title: rgeoboundaries (development version)
text: Removed legacy files reorganized repository layout. Redesigned logo.

title: rgeoboundaries 1.3
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-12 CRAN submission.

title: rgeoboundaries 1.2.9
text: CRAN release: 2023-12-08 Initial CRAN submission.
